channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: ICYMI: the 7 biggest tech stories of the week, from Samsung's tri-fold to a robot for your household chores
item.description: The week's biggest stories from Fitbit, Samsung, OnePlus, Microsoft and a strange humanoid robot called Neo.
item.dc:creator: David Nield, TechRadar

item.title: Hybristophilia: Study links TikTok to women’s sexual attraction to criminals
item.description: Ted Bundy had courtroom groupies. Jeffrey Dahmer and Richard Ramirez were sent love letters in prison. Now, in the age of social media, thousands like, share, and thirst in the comments over stylized fan edits of serial killers. There’s a term for this psychological phenomenon: hybristophilia.
item.dc:creator: Eve Upton-Clark, Fast Company

item.title: AI buildout cements its role as a global catalyst this week
item.description: A momentous week in the technology sector made it clear there is no sign the boom in building artificial intelligence infrastructure is slowing — despite the bubble talk. Nvidia, whose processors are the AI revolution’s backbone, became the first company to surpass $5 trillion in market value.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, Fast Company

item.title: Amazon’s third-quarter results get a boost from its cloud computing business
item.description: Amazon posted higher fiscal third quarter profit and sales compared with a year ago, fueled by accelerating growth in its cloud computing business and strong spending by its customers looking for low prices at a time when inflation is resurging.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Nearly 58 billion personal data points have been leaked online since 2004, new study reveals
item.description: Your digital life is more exposed than you think. A new study from security firm Surfshark has quantified the astonishing scale of data breaches since 2004, revealing that tens of billions of personal data points, from passwords to physical addresses, are now in the wild.
item.dc:creator: Rene Millman, TechRadar

item.title: The AI ‘workslop phase’ is normal. Here’s how to fast-track your way through it
item.description: Every technological revolution has its awkward adolescence. We’re living through AI’s right now. Recent research from Stanford and BetterUp has given this moment a name: “workslop.
item.dc:creator: Kieran Colville, Fast Company

item.title: China ranks last in VPN adoption globally - but it may all be smoke and mirrors
item.description: New research on VPN adoption reveals that China ranks last, but only in terms of downloads from Apple App Store and Google Play Store
item.dc:creator: Silvia Iacovcich, TechRadar

item.title: Netflix weighs bid for Warner Studio and streaming, Reuters says
item.description: Netflix Inc. is actively exploring a bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.'s studio and streaming businesses, Reuters reported, citing people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg, The Mercury News

item.title: YouTube TV just dropped over 20 Disney channels – here's where to watch them instead
item.description: As the YouTube TV and Disney Channel deal breaks down, over 20 channels are now missing – but there's still places to watch them.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Valentine, TechRadar

item.title: Fortnite The Simpsons live event build up: our live coverage of the upcoming The Simpsons crossover including start time and what we know so far
item.description: Here's our live coverage of the Fortnite The Simpsons live event, including everything you need to know in the build up to launch.
item.dc:creator: Jake Green, TechRadar

item.title: OpenAI launches Aardvark to detect and patch hidden bugs in code
item.description: OpenAI has unveiled Aardvark, a GPT-5-powered autonomous agent designed to act like a human security researcher capable of scanning, understanding, and patching code with the reasoning skills of a professional vulnerability analyst.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: From theory to practice: Innovating with AI
item.description: AI is the most high-profile area of ​​technology investment for global CIOs this year, according to 42% of respondents in Foundry’s recent State of the CIO 2025 survey. Interest is pervasive across all industries and geographies.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Nvidia partners with South Korean government, companies to boost AI development
item.description: Silicon Valley chipmaker Nvidia plans to supply its graphics processing units for projects with the South Korean businesses and government to advance the country’s artificial intelligence infrastructure and technologies.
item.dc:creator: Kim Tong-Hyung, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Rust 1.91 promotes Windows on Arm64 to Tier 1 target
item.description: The Rust Release Team has released Rust 1.91, an update of the popular memory-safe programming language that promotes Windows on Arm64 platform to a Tier 1 supported target. Rust 1.91 was announced October 30. Previous users can upgrade by running rustup update stable.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: This rapid SSD moves 1GB in just seconds, and offers fingerprint security - but it'll fit right in your top pocket
item.description: This compact SSD offers rapid transfers and fingerprint access, but its limited capacity and uncertain durability curb its professional potential.
item.dc:creator: Efosa Udinmwen, TechRadar

item.title: Visual Studio October update adds Claude coding models
item.description: Microsoft has released the October 2025 update for Visual Studio 2022 (v17.14). The new release makes the Claude Sonnet 4.5 and Claude Haiku 4.5 coding models available in the GitHub Copilot chat window.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: 183 million email passwords leaked: Check yours now
item.description: Cybersecurity experts warn about one of the largest credential compilations ever found, urging users to check "Have I Been Pwned" and change passwords immediately.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Bessent says TikTok deal finalized
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Thursday the U.S. and China have finalized an agreement on TikTok that would allow the popular social media platform to remain available in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — Don't be fooled by the fog machine, spooky lights and fake bats: the robotics lab at Worcester Polytechnic Institute lab isn't hosting a Halloween party.
item.dc:creator: HOLLY RAMER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: GenAI can save employees 7.5 hours a week
item.description: Questions may linger about whether generative AI (genAI) is taking away jobs, but tools such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, Google Gemini and Microsoft Copilot are apparently making employees more productive.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Adobe AI assistants let you edit images in Photoshop and Express via prompts
item.description: Adobe is developing new generative AI (genAI) assistants that let users edit images in Adobe Express and Photoshop with written prompts. Having embedded AI-based content-generation tools across its apps in recent years, Adobe is rolling out AI assistants and agents.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: Universal Music Group and AI platform Udio have settled a copyright lawsuit and will collaborate on a new music creation and streaming platform.
item.dc:creator: Kelvin Chan, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Key principles of a successful internal developer platform
item.description: Modern software delivery is a story of increasing complexity. As organizations adopt cloud-native technologies, the number of tools, APIs, and processes keeps multiplying.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Run Azure DevOps on premises
item.description: It shouldn’t be a surprise that there’s a lot of Azure you can run on premises, thanks to platforms like Azure Stack. But there’s more to on-premises Azure than the familiar platforms and services.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: AI-generated videos claiming to show Hurricane Melissa have been circulating on social media, causing confusion.
item.dc:creator: Taimoor Sobhan And Kelvin Chan, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Apple Watch Series 11: The things you don’t see
item.description: While there were solid improvements in the last generation of Apple’s popular wearable, the huge 24-hour battery life in Apple Watch Series 11 means this smartwatch has finally become what it always promised to be: a device capable of running all day and all night, which is especially for tasks like
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: GitHub launches Agent HQ to bring order to AI-powered coding
item.description: GitHub is taking a major step toward redefining enterprise software development with the launch of Agent HQ, a platform that lets developers manage and orchestrate multiple AI coding agents from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and others directly within the GitHub environment.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Eclipse LMOS AI platform integrates Agent Definition Language
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation has introduced ADL (Agent Definition Language) functionality to its LMOS (Language Models Operating System) AI project. The announcement came on October 28.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: IT shortcuts curb AI returns
item.description: Nearly all the companies I talk to today are using AI, but most fall short when it comes to getting real value from AI, aside from a select few. Cisco calls these AI standouts the “pacesetters.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: 2025 global network outage report and internet health check
item.description: The reliability of services delivered by ISPs, cloud providers and conferencing services is critical for enterprise organizations.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Beware fake credit card account restriction scams
item.description: A phishing email scam targeting American Express customers shows how cybercriminals use fake urgent messages to steal personal and financial information.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Teen sues AI tool maker over fake nude images
item.description: A New Jersey teenager filed a major lawsuit against AI/Robotics Venture Strategy 3 Ltd. over ClothOff, an AI tool that created fake nude images from her social media photos.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
